CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses (domestic and Convention proceedings) - partial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the town of PERSON , the GPE region , GPE .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in the ORG against Mr S. ( a private person ) seeking recovery of a debt . On DATE the court found for the applicant and ordered Mr S. to pay him ORG CARDINAL ( around QUANTITY – “ EUR ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG instituted enforcement proceedings in respect of the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . According to the applicant , the judgment of DATE has been enforced in part and he was paid ORG CARDINAL ( around EUR CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG about ORG inactivity in respect of the enforcement of the judgment of DATE . On DATE the court found for the applicant , declared ORG inactivity unlawful and ordered the immediate seizure of the property of Mr. S.

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in the ORG against ORG seeking compensation for non - pecuniary damage allegedly caused by the failure of ORG to enforce the judgments of DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court found for the applicant and ordered ORG to pay the applicant ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL ) in compensation for non - pecuniary damage . The court held that due to the failure of ORG to immediately seize the property of Mr S. , as it had been ordered by the judgment of DATE , the latter had sold a substantial part of his property . The court further held that ORG had failed to sell the part of the debtor 's property , which had been seized .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG instituted enforcement proceedings in respect of the judgment of CARDINAL DATE . On DATE ORG appointed ORG to be responsible for the enforcement of the aforementioned judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG informed the applicant that ORG was being funded from ORG and it did not have its own assets suitable for seizure .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG applied to the ORG seeking the interpretation of the way in which the judgment of CARDINAL DATE should be enforced . On DATE the court refused this application , stating that the judgment needed no further interpretation or clarification .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG discontinued the enforcement proceedings and returned the execution writ to the applicant on the grounds that ORG did not have its own assets and was financed by ORG .
CARDINAL . The applicant did not challenge the decision of ORG of DATE before the domestic courts .
CARDINAL . The judgment of CARDINAL DATE remains unenforced .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is summarised in the judgment of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) .
